intro: Ruellia concavifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland areas and along stream banks. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value. Ruellia concavifolia is also valued for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its relatively low maintenance requirements.
